question: [File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-cli/src/lib.rs] [Function: run_cli()] [Disassembly injection] When executing Command::Disassemble at line 84, can malformed bytecode cause the disassembler to crash, leak memory, or execute arbitrary code through buffer overflows? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-cli/src/lib.rs] [Function: run_cli()] [Bytecode validation] Does the disassemble command validate bytecode signatures and integrity before disassembly to prevent processing of maliciously crafted bytecode? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-cli/src/lib.rs] [Function: run_cli()] [HTML injection] When executing Command::Docgen at line 85, can an attacker inject malicious HTML, JavaScript, or XSS payloads through Move doc comments that get rendered in generated documentation? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-cli/src/lib.rs] [Function: run_cli()] [Path injection in docs] Can the docgen command be exploited to write documentation to arbitrary filesystem locations, overwriting important files or creating files in sensitive directories? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-cli/src/lib.rs] [Function: run_cli()] [Error map injection] When executing Command::Errmap at line 86, can an attacker provide malicious error codes or messages that exploit parsing vulnerabilities or inject code into error map outputs? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-cli/src/lib.rs] [Function: run_cli()] [Project initialization] When executing Command::New at line 87, can an attacker exploit the execute_with_defaults method to create malicious project templates with backdoored dependencies or unsafe configurations? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-cli/src/lib.rs] [Function: run_cli()] [Template injection] Does the New command validate project names and paths to prevent creating projects with malicious names that could exploit shell metacharacters or path traversal when used in subsequent commands? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-cli/src/lib.rs] [Function: run_cli()] [Prover resource exhaustion] When executing Command::Prove at line 88, can an attacker craft specifications that cause the Move Prover to consume unbounded memory or CPU, leading to denial of service? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-cli/src/lib.rs] [Function: run_cli()] [Prover SMT injection] Can malicious Move specifications inject SMT solver commands that exploit vulnerabilities in Z3 or other SMT solvers used by the Move Prover? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-cli/src/lib.rs] [Function: run_cli()] [Test execution isolation] When executing Command::Test at lines 89-95, are tests properly isolated from each other, or can one test modify global state (natives, genesis, cost_table) that affects subsequent tests? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-cli/src/lib.rs] [Function: run_cli()] [Test native poisoning] Can a malicious test exploit the natives parameter passed at line 92 to register or modify native functions that persist beyond test execution or affect other tests? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-cli/src/lib.rs] [Function: run_cli()] [Genesis state leak] Does the genesis ChangeSet passed at line 93 get properly reset between test executions, or can state modifications from one test affect subsequent tests, leading to non-deterministic results? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-cli/src/lib.rs] [Function: run_cli()] [Cost table clone safety] At line 94, the cost_table is cloned with Some(cost_table.clone()) - can modifications to the cloned table in test execution affect the original, or can clone operations fail for malformed cost tables causing panics? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-cli/src/lib.rs] [Function: run_cli()] [Test parameter asymmetry] Why do only Test commands receive natives, genesis, and cost_table parameters? Can this create security gaps where other commands should also validate these parameters but don't receive them? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-cli/src/lib.rs] [Struct: MoveCLI] [Argument parsing] Does the #[derive(Parser)] macro at line 50 properly validate all input arguments, or can malformed inputs cause panics, buffer overflows, or unexpected behavior in clap parsing? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-cli/src/lib.rs] [Function: move_cli()] [Parse safety] When MoveCLI::parse() is called at line 104, can maliciously crafted command-line arguments exploit parsing vulnerabilities to cause crashes or code execution? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-cli/src/lib.rs] [Struct: Move] [Global flag injection] The global flags (--path, -v, build_config) at lines 35-44 are accessible to all subcommands - can an attacker combine flags in unexpected ways to bypass security checks or cause command confusion? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-cli/src/lib.rs] [Struct: Move] [Verbose flag abuse] Can the verbose flag at line 39-40 be exploited to leak sensitive information like file paths, environment variables, or internal state that should not be exposed? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-cli/src/lib.rs] [Function: run_cli()] [Concurrent execution] If run_cli() is called concurrently from multiple threads with different natives, genesis, or cost_table parameters, can race conditions occur in shared state or global variables? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-cli/src/lib.rs] [Function: move_cli()] [Reentrancy] Can move_cli() be safely called multiple times in the same process, or do static variables, globals, or cached state create reentrancy issues? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-cli/src/lib.rs] [Constant: DEFAULT_STORAGE_DIR] [Race condition] When multiple commands access DEFAULT_STORAGE_DIR = 'storage' concurrently, are there TOCTOU vulnerabilities or file locking issues? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-cli/src/lib.rs] [Type: NativeFunctionRecord] [Memory leak] Can the Vec<NativeFunctionRecord> parameter cause memory leaks if functions are registered but never freed, especially with long-running CLI sessions? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-cli/src/lib.rs] [Function: run_cli()] [Resource exhaustion] Are there limits on the size of the natives vector, genesis ChangeSet, or cost_table to prevent memory exhaustion attacks? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-cli/src/lib.rs] [Function: move_cli()] [Unbounded allocation] When parsing CLI arguments, can an attacker provide extremely long strings or deeply nested options that cause unbounded memory allocation? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-cli/src/lib.rs] [Function: run_cli()] [Error leakage] When commands return Result<()> errors, do error messages properly sanitize file paths, user data, or internal state to prevent information disclosure? (Low)
